1900450.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900450
In-book reference  : Book 6, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 6, Hadith 001
1900450.text: Abu Rimtha informed: “I came to the Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) with a son of mine, so he said; ‘Is this your son?’ I said: ‘Yes, I acknowledge him!’ He said: ‘He must not harm you, and you must not harm him!’ I also noticed that the grayness of his hair was reddish.”

1900460.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900460
In-book reference  : Book 6, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 6, Hadith 002
1900460.text: Abu Huraira was asked: “Did Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) dye [his hair]?” He said: “Yes!”

1900470.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900470
In-book reference  : Book 6, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 6, Hadith 003
1900470.text: Al-Jahdama, the wife of Bishr ibn al- Khasasiyya, said: "I saw Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) come out of his house shaking his head, for he had performed the major ritual ablution, and on his head there was some trace of henna." (Or he said: saffron. The Shaikh doubted this.)

1900481.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900481
In-book reference  : Book 6, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 6, Hadith 004
1900481.text: Humaid told us that Anas said: "I saw the hair of Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace)dyed.”

1900482.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1900482
In-book reference  : Book 6, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 6, Hadith 005
1900482.text: Hammad said: 'Abdullah ibn Muhammad ibn 'Uqail also informed us: "I saw the hair of Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) dyed in the presence of Anas ibn Malik."
